PS The Slovaks fought with the Germans in Russia, but 'deserted' in the Slovak National Uprising of 1944. Much like the Polish Uprising this was a preliminary that removed considerable oppostion to the later Communist take-over in Czechoslovakia. You shouldn't send free thinkers to synoptic war.

content: http://calvininjax.wordpress.com/2009/04/22/czech-troops-under-fire-for-withdrawing-from-missions-in-afghanistan/ quote: ... Czech Defence Minister Vlasta Parkanova has launched an investigation into the unit’s behaviour, saying that some of its personnel could be dismissed. But its commanding officer, Petr Krcmar, has claimed that the accusations are nothing more than an excuse to dissolve the group, which operated under British command during a tour of Afghanistan that ended last year. The SOG unit of up to 35 soldiers was deployed as part of the NATO-led International Security Assistance Force (ISAF) in Logar province in eastern Afghanistan. The newspaper said SOG should not be confused with an acclaimed special unit of 100 soldiers serving in the southern Kandahar province within the Enduring Freedom operation. The scandal, which has damaged the reputation of the Czech armed forces, apparently reflects deep-seated problems within the SOG and its relationship with the defense ministry. The SOG commanders argued that Czech laws did not say clearly whether their unit, trained to free hostages, should also help fight terrorists or protect humanitarian convoys. The Czech defense ministry has also been criticized for its handling of the affair. Used on close-protection duties, the SOG comes under the command of the defense ministry rather than the Czech general staff.
